meanings.definition: to insert a tube into a body cavity or organ
meanings.sent1: The doctor will intubate the patient during surgery.
meanings.sent2: It is necessary to intubate the feeding tube for the patient.
meanings.sent3: I tried to intubate the straw into the juice box, but it was too small.
meanings.sent4: The plumber had to intubate a new pipe into the old system.
meanings.sent5: She intubated the pen into the holder on her desk.

meanings.definition: to provide artificial respiration by inserting a tube into the trachea
meanings.sent1: In emergency situations, medical professionals intubate patients to help them breathe.
meanings.sent2: The paramedic had to intubate the unconscious person at the scene.
meanings.sent3: The firefighter joked that he could intubate the hose to put out the fire.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to intubate a new exhaust pipe into the car's engine.
meanings.sent5: The scuba diver intubated the oxygen tank before going underwater.
